page.title: 06Agriculture
page.content: Every Kilometre square in this area includes arable grassland. Sheep predominate over cattle, though there are a few herds of freisians, which are mostly reared for the production of beef. Only one farm of the l5 in the area has a milking herd. Crops grown include wheat, winter barley, flax and oil seed rape. These crops are harvested betwen June and August for the corn and rape, and the flax in October - all by combine harvester. If the corn is wet it is dried before marketing. One farm has a dryer. The grass is cut and made into silage in spring and in the summer is cut for hay, both being used for cattle fodder during the winter. There are four market gardens growing vegetables and flowers, one supplying direct to the trade and the rest either selling from the premises or supplying retailers.
